pullRequest.body:
Another distributivity lemma with iUnion and insertions, needed for #21172. 

This could maybe be `@[simp]`

---

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message

- ...

Deletions:

- ...

### PR summary [72eb7bf91b](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21322/commits/72eb7bf91b42f55a94a938e3fd0e35e4bb34159e)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ iUnion_insert_eq_range_union_iUnion`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

> Thanks. Let's generalize this to index by `Sort*`

I originally had it this way, and it broke a couple of things far downstream. I guess i will fix them, rather than just change it back to type.

> > Thanks. Let's generalize this to index by `Sort*`
> 
> I originally had it this way, and it broke a couple of things far downstream. I guess i will fix them, rather than just change it back to type.

This should now (hopefully) be fixed by adding `[-iUnion_singleton_eq_range]` to three `simp` calls where the lemma hadn't previously been firing.

Actually, it does seem like this causes some `simp` regressions. In some cases there are just missing confluence lemmas, where something exists for `iUnion` but not `range`, but in others (such as in `Topology.Instances.Real.Lemmas`) I'm not quite sure what the fix is. 

I think this is out of scope - can we leave the `Sort` upgrade for another PR?

maintainer merge

I suppose
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by Ruben-VandeVelde.

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:

  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13148692311/job/36692043659)
Thanks. Let's generalize this to index by `Sort*`
Thanks. Let's generalize this to index by `Sort*`

```suggestion
theorem iUnion_singleton_eq_range (f : Î¹ â†’ Î²) : â‹ƒ x : Î¹, {f x} = range f := by
```

```suggestion
theorem iUnion_insert_eq_range_union_iUnion (x : Î¹ â†’ Î²) (t : Î¹ â†’ Set Î²) :
```
